body: @ssisk I agree with the general sentiment that we should not add HIFIO tests for every existing datastore that supports HIF, however I think we should prioritize those who don't exist yet in Beam, for example I will remove without hesitation the HIFIElastic classes and put this because we don't have a native way to read Hive HCatalog records yet. We shall probably do the same for others (e.g. HIFICassandra) once the native implementations are already merged. WDYT ?
Other issue to discuss later on is if this examples probably should exist as independent modules considering that we can really fast get into dependency problems.
Merged on `DSL_SQL` branch, you can close this Pull Request. Thanks !

Coverage increased (+0.02%) to 70.722% when pulling **9e93443743f299f79cf1512a9467ba37031a08b8 on jbonofre:BEAM-245-CASSANDRA** into **924dd63353ed6d44b937d0b0cbdd2c8bcd8c9716 on apache:master**.

Noting down initial comments from email thread - 

@jkff  -
From the point of view of general source/sink development, this code looks reasonable, except for a few violations of https://beam.apache.org/contribute/ptransform-style-guide/ (mainly around
https://beam.apache.org/contribute/ptransform-style-guide/#runtime-errors-and-data-consistency)
and other easily fixable things.

Would be good to get some extra input from people experienced with Hive on whether this is the right API or if there are any pitfalls to avoid.

@jbonofre -
- javadoc is not correct in HiveIO (it says write() for read ;)).
- estimated size is global to the table (doesn't consider the filter). It's not a big deal, but it should be documented.
- you don't use the desired bundle size provided by the runner for the split. 
You are using the Hive split count, which is fine, just explain in the main javadoc maybe.
- the reader should set current to null with nothing is read
- getCurrent() should throw NoSuchElementException in case of current is null
- in the writer, the flush should happen at the end of the batch as you did, but also when the bundle is finished

@iemejia -
maybe it is a good idea for the guys working on the Beam SQL implementation to take a look at their needs for this IO considering that it could be quite useful to test the SQL (given the structured nature of HCatalog).

Fixed typo

I've been watching the behavior of kubernetes, and it changes the pod IPs fairly frequently (every time the VM goes down for maintenance.) I'm going to investigate how long it's going to take me to get perfkit benchmarker reading IP addresses from the kubernetes cluster (I'm hoping it's not that long) and just do that work - that way we don't have to worry about the pod IP changing, breaking the tests, and then doing a manual fix.

The test failure seems legit https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/org.apache.beam$beam-examples-java/11682/testReport/org.apache.beam.examples/WordCountIT/testE2EWordCount_4/

Github's UI makes it difficult to track which comments have been responded to when I receive notifications - please post a comment on this PR explicitly saying when you'd like me to take another look (though responses individual comments are still useful to make sure they were all handled in some way).

@iemejia these ITs don't have:
1) an accompanying k8s script to set up small/large instances of HiveIO
2) data load scripts

So Beam can't run the tests in this PR as-is. That's what's useful about the current ES/cassandra HIFIO ITs.

I think it *could* be useful to add tests like these to verify that HIFIO works for things that we don't have direct support yet, but we need data stores to test against. It's also not clear how expensive these types of tests are in the long run - for example, these HIFIO compat tests could *potentially* just be a small unit test since we aren't really testing beam code with this test and don't need to worry about scale/etc..
@jkff , I have addressed your comments + those of @jbonofre . I am waiting for a consensus on @ssisk 's comments on using GroupIntoBatchesTransform

It looks good now it seems.

@ssisk and @jkff you are right about the fact that GroupIntoBatches is a good simplification for this code however I don't think we should do this at this moment, because there is still a big issue. Not all the runners support the State/Timer API today so this will limit the use of this IO to only the runners who do.

I think we should create a new independent JIRA for the use of GroupIntoBatches when most of the runners support both the State/Timer APIs. We can even create a meta-JIRA to cover other IOs that do batches like this, e.g. ElasticSearchIO, another idea would be to include this in a de-facto and abstract manner for the SDF API. WDYT ? I can create the JIRA if you agree.

@seshadri-cr Another thing that we already discussed in the review of the HIFIO based version of the IO is that the Hive name is inappropriate considering the fact that this IO is used only to access the HCatalog part of Hive. So please don't forget to rename this in every place it makes sense (even for the module name).
Also remember to add <module>hcatalog</module> in the sdks/java/io/pom.xml file so the io includes the parent version dependencies.
@seshadri-cr Also remember to add <module>hcatalog</module> in the sdks/java/io/pom.xml file so the io includes the parent version dependencies.

Yes, I will work on the unit test for this PR. I will update it once ready !

Regards,
Seshadri
